reviews.text: What can one say about any Premier Inn? I suppose the only answer is that they generally do what they say on the tin. The location is far from pretty but you book here because it is a one night stop-over to somewhere else rather than staying for a two week family holiday. Having said that the rooms are pretty good (much better than Weymouth, for example) and the breakfat sausages were excellent. Of note also was the friendly welcome by the reception staff. On the downside the shower did not work properly.
reviews.title: Can never get excited about a Premier Inn but...

reviews.text: Good hotel, had all amenities, good car park and dining on site.
reviews.title: Homeward bound

reviews.text: I chose this hotel as it was close to the water park that I was treating my boys too for a birthday treat. It was easy to find and the young girl even gave me a courtisy call to make sure I found it ok. all the staff were very friendly and made both me and my boys very welcome, my youngest didn't want to leave!! We will certainly be using it again.
reviews.title: Weekend break with my two boys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a disabled person this was our second premier inn holiday ,the first was in blackpool in november which was fantastic we thought everything would be the same. but we were disappointed that the bed was much lower i really struggled getting in and out of bed.Everything else was lovely staff were very friendly and willing to help the room was very clean. So premier inn please make sure the beds in your disabled rooms are a better hieght.
reviews.title: disabled second stay

reviews.text: Great stay here, staff excellent can't do enough for you. Everyone had a smile on their face.
reviews.title: Can't beat this place

reviews.text: We booked in for a few days with friends & this was our first stay at a Premier Inn. We found the staff very helpful & pleasent & enjoyed the 2 evening meals that we ate there. The special offer of buy 2 glasses of wine & get the rest of the bottle free was appreciated. The only gripes were that the pillows were too hard & there was a cracked tile around the bath tap. Apart from these issues, The room was very comfortable and was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable

reviews.text: There were creaking noises from above when anyone in the room above walked across the floor, but this did not cause a problem during the night.
reviews.title: Not bad but not good either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at several Premier Inns and enjoy their value and consistency. However, this was the poorest stay we have had. There was some traffic noise from our bedroom on the side facing the main (50mph) road, albeit not desperately bad. The bathroom was a little tired, with some deteriorating paint and fittings. And the cooked breakfast was very average - on arrival there was little left and a buffet refresh took 10 minutes. When it did arrive the bacon was chewy and the sausages anaemic, bordering on undercooked.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Finally, the location - close to the sewerage and very far from the old town / harbour - was not ideal for our stay.
reviews.title: Impressed!

reviews.text: That all said, the staff were very friendly and approachable and the room was tidy / clean. Neverthless, we much prefered our earlier stay at Holiday Inn Holes Bay Road.
reviews.title: what more can you want for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3rd stay at this hotel whilst visiting our son. Staff again excellent and food and bar staff vey efficient and accommodating. Bed rooms a good size with welcoming bar and restaurant area.
reviews.title: As good as last time we stayed

reviews.text: Visiting our daughter in Bournemouth for the weekend, decided to stay at the PI Poole North. Being our first time at a Premier Inn we were more than pleasantly surprised , Staff were friendly, informative and interested in us. The room was clean and comfortable, we had a good nights sleep ! We will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Poole North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very recently stayed at the Premier Inn, Poole North, Dorset, and can honestly say that the rooms, as far as cleanliness, comfort, ambience, were better than the Hilton that we had stayed in the previous night.
reviews.title: Premier Inn, Poole North

reviews.text: All the staff were lovely, attentive and friendly, and the price of the rooms via the internet, were a st=eal at £29 per night.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: The Hilton cost us £129 a night, and was inferior.
reviews.title: A good nights kip!

reviews.text: Stayed here to visit relatives so only needed a quiet place to put our heads down, and thats exactly what the Premier Inn was. Quiet. The hotel may be located in an industrial estate, and looks pretty industrial from the outside, but on a weekend this means there is virtually no external noise. Rooms were warm on one of the coldest February nights ever, 30 mins Wifi is nice but a hardly a dealmaker. Breakfast was varied but cooked fare was average at best.
reviews.title: A trip back home

reviews.text: All in all though a Clean, Warm, Quiet place for a family to have a night sleep.. Simples...
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and twi children on a very cold night in February. Although the rooms were chilly to start with, it warmed up once we turned up the radiator. The reception and bar area were very cold however, though that was the only downside. The rooms were clean and large enough, the shower was hot, the breakfast was brilliant and the staff were friendly and helpful. We will be back.
reviews.title: Excellent value but with a few minor problems

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in North Poole paying £19 per night. The size, cleanliness and quality of room was good. The bed was comfy and the bathroom a fair size. However, the floors are rather creeky, especially from the people above us. It was good to have control over the room temperature as it was cold outside whilst staying at the PI. The car park was spacious. The reception staff were friendly and helpful regarding the local buses. We only ate dinner in the restaurant. I paid £9.30 for fish pie & peas. Bottle of wine about £11.99. Food hot and OK for price paid. Our room was at the front so only heard distant traffic noise when window slightly open.
reviews.title: I would stay again

reviews.text: Although the room and our stay at the PI was good we did have a few minor problems. Firstly the radio didn't work within the TV. As a radio 4 fan (and especially The Archers) this was a disappointment. I mentioned the problem to the staff but they seemed surprised anyone even wanted to listen to the radio. The TV worked but the message on the TV said no signal when I tried to get radio 4. We don't all need free WiFi and hairdryers a good radio signal will surfice. Another thing which bugged my husband was that they never topped up the decaff coffee. Each day he had to go to reception and ask for a few sachets.The bedside lights weren't that brilliant for reading either.
reviews.title: A great value family-friendly hotel!
